Package ui

Class MenuButton

java.lang.Object
ui.MenuButton
public class MenuButton extends Object
This class represents 1 Button on the Menu GameState. A button will be linked to different GameStates so that the Game can change states based on what button is pushed.
Author:
John Botonakis

  • Constructor Details

    • MenuButton

      public MenuButton(int xpos, int ypos, int rowIndex, GameStates state)
      Generates a menu button object
      Parameters:
      xpos - - X-Position on the Screen
      ypos - - Y-Position on the screen
      rowIndex - - Row index to determine which button to draw
      state - - Determines what state of the game the button is linked to. Once hit, this game state will load in.

  • Method Details

    • initBounds

      private void initBounds()
      Initializes a rectangle around the button to determine if mouse is intersecting within.

    • loadImgs

      private void loadImgs(int rowIndex)
      Loads in image to represent the button from a specified sprite sheet
      Parameters:
      rowIndex - - Row index to determine which button to draw.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics g)
      Draws the button to the screen with the specified parameters
      Parameters:
      g - - the Graphics where to draw the MenuButton

    • update

      public void update()
      Sets behavior when this instance of the button is interacted with, be it mouse or keyboard input.

    • resetButton

      public void resetButton()
      reset all booleans in the mouse (mouseOver and mousePressed)

    • applyGamestate

      public void applyGamestate()
      Set the GameState to whatever value was selected by the user, that value is stored in the menuButton as "state"
